pYKHNwrXow_A4JEWgsOPLg.text: Honestly, about the best I can come up with for this place is "meh." We came here for a meeting a few weeks ago and I wasn't feeling all that hungry. Either that of the menu was so blah that it turned my appetite into a thing of the past.I ordered the scallops because I love scallops but these were sadly waaaay too overdone and rubbery and there is nothing worse in the scallop world than a scallop you can bounce off the floor. I also tried the rocket salad, which I must say is a far cooler word for arugula than our American version, so that was worth something. As for a beverage I ordered a bottle of coke which was 2.25 pounds. That seems pretty high for a soda, but oh well. The decor also left me a bit cold. It just didn't have anything memorable going for it, which I guess gelled perfectly with the food. Would I come back here? Most likely not, but maybe you'll like it. Never know.

O0l0RNxILL7xIRSL8JD4wA.text: Their Banoffee Pie is the bomb!  Of course, I'm not British so I may not be a connoisseur but it's just the perfect balance of creaminess and toffee-ness. They have hot, friendly, Spanish-speaking wait staff too.  Ooh la la!!!

V8jAFwx0tC9b-4DkLdRe9Q.text: The idea was that we'd trot in here for Christmas lunch, as it was open on Christmas day. And actually, it was all rather nice! The menu was appropriate, if a bit limited, and the main course (predictably, I went for the turkey with all the trimmings) was perfectly lovely. The best bit about it, though, was the "Porn Star" martinis (passion fruit) with a shot of champagne on the side. Excellent! Well, that and the fact that the Christmas crackers contained three-foot-long tube-shaped balloons which everyone was blowing up and releasing around the room. The atmosphere was friendly and enjoyably loud (ie: conversation rather than music); and the staff looked after us brilliantly. I understand from reading the reviews that ordinarily the Balans experience can be a bit mediocre, and while this wasn't blow-your-mind excellent, it was certainly very good value for money on Christmas day, and entirely convivial.

ulv5ycaFiMVxD9sKY0Pgdw.text: Without a doubt some of the most insignificant food I have had for a while ! Given the bill for two at just under £100.00, I would have expected far better, but alas Id group this Restaurant with Garfunkel's and such like !!On the up side, the service was swift with lots of well groomed Managers hanging about..I did order the Days special "Roast" which they then did not have !Give this one a miss people, I'm sad to say that as I expected so much more ..I did tell my waiter I was far from impressed  & would not come back ... I guess he was not that interested !

3u7qQ4GNa2bRn3Hr0Wcdcg.text: I personally don't really like balans in Soho not for its taste in food or decor but mainly for its high attitude waiters. Last time I went with a few friends ordering food was a mission in itself, first the waiter has to drag himself away from his mirror and then somewhat later you actually get noticed and ordering well that is something else. We ordered a simple two course meal and the main course arrived first and then the starter and what we ordered was very simple the waiter got us mixed up with another table and refused to budge on the matter, its simple a mad circus in there. The food is really nice and you get really good drinks, I personally like the cocktails. Brunch is much better as I love there Egg's Benedict and their salads. The location is awesome, right in the middle of old Compton Street, Soho. So really good if your out bar hopping from one bar to another or just a great place to meet up with mates. The prices are really good too, not that expensive.

b6qypLMhgwrdtofBmZUu5A.text: My memories of Balans are hazy at best as it's one of the only places you can go post-club in Soho and to be honest this is the only time I'd really bother coming as it's pretty expensive and only quite nice. However, because of the late late opening, it does have quite a convivial atmosphere and is a fun place to sober up a bit before bed. It's gay-focussed (on Old Compton Street - durr) but friendly to all like pretty much everywhere else along here.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

IMXM9jkDhhphkhlorqq7tw.text: If you suffer from late night munchies after a night on the sherry then this hits the spot. The food is quite nice although to be honest I have only eaten things that soak up the alcohol I consumed earlier so its worth reading some other reviews as well. The burgers are nice and the spicy noodles tasty if not a bit messy!The place itself does have quite a cool feel about it and is a great people watching spot as some of the sights are quite entertaining.A great place to finish off your night!

qspYjI6wRXu5IfvnInLKnw.text: I had the worst time in here. Came for Sunday Brunch with some friends and we had to complain so much. The service was terrible from start to finish. We were glared at for asking for a table of six (they had to put to tables together you see). Then we were ignored for ages. Once we got our order in, some more friends joined us. Ten minutes later they got their food. When we asked why we'd been waiting half an hour and they got served first, their explanation was that our friends were ' in a different department'. Then the waitress came over to tell us they had no crumpets left. But it took her half an hour. My eggs Benidict was cold. Our final latecomer didn't even get the menu he asked for so went hungry. It took me ten more minutes to get a glass of water. By which time we'd asked for the bill about four times. We didn't pay service, which they had the nerve to question. They also never apologised for being so incompetent. I'll never come back here. There are enough decent places to get breakfast in Soho. Including a place on the Wardour St/Old Compton St corner that does great bacon and egg sandwiches. I'll go there instead. I have to give Balans a star, but I don't want to. Grrrr I'm still annoyed by this place after a month.

YjQ86DtKBt9AN4tegNztIw.text: This slightly pricey, slightly pretentious little eaterie on Old Compton Street is a good place to meet friends before embarking on a good night out. With a wide-ranging menu which caters for most tastes and a good range of wines and cocktails it certainly is a good place to treat yourself to once in a while. Personally I find the service a bit hit and miss with some of the staff making you feel that you're impinging on their posing time, though the food always makes up for it. Nice place to come for brunch also where the atmosphere is more relaxed, though the venue stays quite as busy

Yndz266FzLBPConEI3qGSQ.text: I use to love Balans but the last two visits I felt a little disappointed and kind of feel that it has lost its way a little.The service is good and I quite like the prancing around that the boys do as it all adds to the Old Compton street vibe and the food is usually good but I would not for a special occasion where as we would of done a couple of years ago.

b_jz0xUsYzju8z4eiNwiVA.text: I've been to Balans twice and almost walked out in frustration on both occasions. The staff have to been the most pretentious, preening set of individuals I've ever had the misfortune to encounter in a restaurant. Customers very definitely come way down on their list of priorities. A 45 minute wait for a salad in a half-empty restaurant is not my idea of good service. To have this followed by errors on the bill (both times) and to be told to keep your hair on when I asked for it to be correcteddire. Avoid at all costs.

ZQO1wOQTxzsn6OU0aYYzWQ.text: I travel alot to London for work,  usually staying in the St. Martins Lane hotel.  Unlike a lot of people who end up here after the clubs close, I choose this place for breakfast every time I'm in London.  I'm picky when it comes to Eggs Benedict - I think poached eggs are a travesty of justice, so, I order scrambled.  But, the combination of tasty ham, fluffy eggs and a perfect hollandaise served on a true English muffin, brilliant.  Service at this one is usually very charming, versus the cafe down the street.  I'll definitely be back on my next trip.

UL2P9Qp7Ot7e8YoC-FzGKQ.text: Balans is what it is really - it's a lively gay restaurant that's there to provide a bit of high energy eating! The restaurant is quite dark with coloured lighting to give it some atmosphere. I actually really like this about Balans. It also has good house music playing in the background, which always makes me feel in the mood and alive. The service is ok - not overly friendly, though not unfriendly either. The menu is fine and the food is quite good. This is a decent late night venue - I hate the rush of bars closing at 11 and then having nowhere to go after to just relax - so this for me provides that space. I can imagine lots of people finding this place unwelcoming or pretentious, but I never really experience that myself.

EIKaDEbsRT7hEvUmPHqwmg.text: I think people are missing the point here...I love going to Balans in Old Compton Street...(though not the one in Chiswick) cos it's busy, buzzy, noisy and a great place for people watching....getting tipsy....and having fun.....you can walk in at anytime and get served....is the food outstanding...NO....is the service tip top...NO...but it has a certain charm and I for one would miss it horribly if it wasn't there..if you're looking for a sedate dinner with great food where you can be heard....keep walking...if you're looking for a fun place to either start or end a fairly wild night or fuel up half way through it....walk this way....xx

riWBXFUZfYUD7JVf3P8vMw.text: Late night restaurants are normally a bit hit and miss and Balans is no different. Although the quality of the food is generally good and the decor is very pleasant, the prices are ridicules, at 5 pound for a single sausage it seems that they count on there customers being too drunk to realize the extortion going on. Added to the silly prices is the same old story of the staff having rotten attitudes and not realizing that they are actually there to serve customers instead of posing being rude. Im told that during the day it's a different story, but to be honest after my early hours visit last year its put me off going again.

gl4duYbNpmPqQL1Lom86JA.text: Great place to go when when other places have closed. I love their iced mocha! Sadly, menu is very limited for vegetarians. Atmosphere is friendly. Be careful because they slap on an optional service charge on everything.

1c56RawUg3yKCV_ceNEY_A.text: I'm pretty shocked at some of the reviews on Balans...be warned there are two of these on Old Compton Street. The little one is perfect for a very, very, very early breakfast. By early I mean that certain realm of time where you're only just stumbling out of the club at 5am while early morning commuters look at you with disdain. Yes, you will have to queue, yes it doesn't look like your typical breakfast cafe but there just aren't many places in central London that will give you a full English AND put up with your inebriated giggling when the sun is just coming up. Further down the road is the big Balans, this is where you should be lathering up pre-club. The food, I have to admit, is pretty mediocre. The cocktails on the other hand at a reasonable 5-8 quid a pop are pretty special. If you're going to drink on the gayest street in London may as well get some fabulous gay drinks too and these gays are excellent at cocktails. So if you've had a bad experience go back, have a frozen passionfruit daquiri and give it a second chance.

xlvrqgnLLH2OmC10P29AZA.text: Really deteriorated. With disinterested service and run of the mill food, why bother? One of the servers kept reaching over the banquette to serve from behind. Probably just as well... wasn't much of a looker anyway.

coeRZ4UHVhQfJ9-bGvB_9A.text: Had a very random dinner in here late at night with the Queen's hairdresser after a party at Punk nightclub. Yes, the real Queen - her majesty. It was the first place we found because we were starving and he said it did brilliant food! I'm not sure about brilliant - bog standard sandwiches with chips and pretty ordinary choices (not what I had expected from the trendy Queen's hairdresser) but it went down well after a long night boozing! Right on Old Compton Street so very convenient when falling out of a bar or club and in need of something substantial.

ZJRC_cXLJTwj01YeLozYnw.text: this place gets 1 star because of its bouncers! a decision to charge people £2.50 each for the pleasure of eating in an average restaurant is disappointing to say the least. management need to rectify this or risk losing repeat business

mGFfsmi6X_XC1yNFAFlz0w.text: Food and service almost consistently good, a bit pricey for what it it is, but you are in London, after all...Be careful...the pre-dinner breads are not free, you will be charged for them.  Otherwise, always a nice place for a good meal...

VxDXDmxzhTgwGXyjv0WqEQ.text: Love Balans. I've been going there for the last 10 years and feel like I've charted my age with the place. When I first came to London, i came here after a night's clubbing for a 4am burger or a 7am fry up. A little older and I was coming here for a cheapish (though it didn't feel so at the time) bite to eat with a date from it's diner classic menu. Now it's the perfect spot for a meeting over brunch or an afternoon coffee before meeting clients. It's nothing special, but like thousands of Londoners over the years, it will always be a place I'll go back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

6zJrmCPI_WqOs3qq3IFEfA.text: Oh dear Balans, you really have fallen from grace On a recent visit to this staple Soho haunt I ordered braised beef with mashed potatoes. The beef was inedible, the taste of it was so vile I couldn't finish it, and thought better of complaining. It was so rancid I actually thought it was off. The food at Balans just isn't worth the large price tag, even if the atmosphere and cocktails are great. There are now so many better places to eat in Soho they shouldn't get away with serving sub standard food at such extortionate prices. I won't be going back.

bWs5UTJyi3kcw9aTMUhEdA.text: This used to be a haunt of mine. It used to be a leading player on the gay scene. It as one of the places to hang put and eat if you were gay or gay-friendly.  Well my mate and I went for lunch on Saturday. The waiter was welcoming and helpful and our opening Bloody Mary was top-class. That gets them their 2 stars.My starter (scallops) was the stingiest portion I've ever seen and our main course ("fresh" tuna with a wasabi crust) was awful. My mate left his -  I'd just been to the gym so would have eaten anything. And did.To top it all there was an irritating hen party group in - quite why they are allowed in I don't know. But they started to stare at other customers then take photos and finally one of them filmed the restaurant with her iPad - as if they were visiting a zoo. The Manager seemed uninterested but we, and other customers, were really annoyed.So I think it's best to avoid this place now - we certainly won't be going back.

WupQlJkaovB6-sK03Mxzqg.text: The service was good and the place was just ok. I enjoyed their special that day which was ham-wrapped chicken encrusted with ground pistachios. It was delicious. I haven't tasted anything else so I'll keep them at three stars for now. On busy nights, service can be a little slow, understandably. Though really, you come here for the late-night grub and not really for fine dining.

UupKDG3WFzy-sQAHD-_yyQ.text: I've eaten at three of the branches (Kensington, Earls Court and Soho). They all have very different atmosphere and types of service, although you can feel the continuity in the formula. I've been to Soho twice in the past month and I have to say it's great for a buzzing atmosphere. I agree with some of the others as the food doesn't set my heart on fire here, it's pretty standard bistro style plates you can produce at home, with a bit of effort. The cocktails are usually good and great in happy hour.I do have a small gripe with the staff in Soho coz at times they spend a little too long getting into whatever banter is flying around that night and the customer is stood waiting for them to finish their little comedy sketchusually the manager breaks it up!

Vaf87N57fviITHoyGOUnxw.text: One of the most popular dining places in Soho, Balans is primarily endears itself to the gay market though, obviously, it is open to all. I think this is one of the better places to have brunch with friends and its evening menu is superb with lots of options. It's is quite pricey so maybe not a place to drop into for a snack but if you're up for a small treat or meeting old friends then It's certainly worth visiting. Great cocktails and desserts also help persuade the unsure, though the staff can be hit or miss in their service, sometimes they are great, attentive and engage with the customer though once or twice Iâve been made to feel like I'm impinging on them by asking them to do their job. Long opening hours also makes this a place to end a good night out, soaking up the alcohol and sating your appetites.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Balans

3d0t9xKpicEEqWyPxchxHw.text: The drinks are amazing, cannot fault that at all. The food is fresh and for the more adventurous foodies out there, you too will have an interesting assortment of fare to choose from. Get's a bit crowded, but that's what the cafe's for...it's not too far either.

3X-bTVJyOpdfsxRgQ4kwhA.text: I had drinks and dinner here about a month ago. I have to say, I wasn't expecting much (see the reviews below), but actually, had some great service by one of their super-camp and perfectly hilarious waiters - and one of the best burgers I've eaten in a long time.I'm not usually a fan of eating a burger out, I'd rather make my own, and even then it seems a waste of good meat. But hey, my friend was in the mood so we went for it. I wish we'd only ordered one though! Staple cocktails are two for one till 7 (I think? Maybe 6 - don't shoot me). We had a few Bellinis upon arrival, which were tasty and quick to be delivered.It's a nice little stop off for an early dinner and drink before heading out  into Soho. I'll be honest. I'd rather go to Lab a few doors down (now called Academy) or pop over to Cafe Boheme for some food. If someone asked me to meet them there, I'd go for a few, but if I had the choice, I'd rather go elsewhere.

C4QsbFp7cXt4MB9-ETx3bA.text: Warning: there are TWO Balans on Old Compton Street. We waited for one another for 20 mins and then I realised there must be two. You have been warned. Secondly, Old Compton street is the most gay street in Soho. It is v gay friendly. You open a gay friendly place on this street and you will make money, irrespective of quality. That does not create a keen competitive environment to keep standards high. You have been warned. Balans gave me a very friendly welcome (I supposed I do look a bit gay with my shaven head). They gave a nice table in a shabby looking room. The menu looked great. The eggs benedict were the worst I ever had: Burned bacon, eggs full of water & over-cooked, Hollandaise with a crusty skin. The smoothie was moderate but over-priced. Not a great place, but then in retrospect, its not really there to serve good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

KFYpaTzfdal5MrP_XWUfvA.text: This Balans, in particular, is great for late night grub. I order the same thing every time (Chicken Thai noodles). I think it's rather good and a fun and buzzy place to go. I don't really think it's all that pricey as a couple others have mentioned, but I don't tend to buy a lot of drinks because I go here to end the night .  Mains are between £10- £12 unless you order steak or something similar.  I also have never paid a cover to get in and wouldn't.  Maybe that happens much later, I don't know.We hit this place after the theatre or when we want to get food after going out for drinks.I have never been here for breakfast so cannot comment at all on that.  For me, Balans has been strictly late-ish night, but still dinner food.Note: This place is definitely not Italian.  I tried to re-categorize it but there's no "eclectic" tag.  The food ranges from Thai,  Mexican, and European to French and African.  I think it kind of fills the role that a diner would in the US, but it's not really a diner so much..

27W6ZMIWnoJHt9_1HULkzw.text: So it's 5am in London, you need breakfast and you need it now. Get in a cab to Balan's on Old Compton Street. We rocked up here a little the worse for wear demanding more booze and food. World weary bouncers told us no booze :-( and everyone has to pay the £2.50 cover charge. Shizz, talk about taking the people for a ride!With club flashing lights and pumping music, the night never needs to end. Despite our inebriation, I can comment on the food. The hollandaise sauce on my eggs benedict was a bit over done, but you can't expect perfect from a chef working the 5am shift. My blueberry pancakes on the other hand were incredible. Balan's, you are the drunks' lifesaver! No surprise this is on Old Compton Street, the gays are a smart people.

w6ACOUWPsHe9r619o1BkkQ.text: The food was decent.  I had sea bass and my wife had roast pork belly, which came in an enormous slab that could feed an entire village.  What made the experience memorable was our waiter, a young Latvian guy who we'll call Ludvigs  Helpfulskis.When asked his opinion on the pork belly vs. the mushroom linguine, Ludvigs responded, "One is pasta.  The other is meat."  Then, at the end of the meal, when my wife asked if she could have the remaining 19 kgs of her dish wrapped up to go, Ludvigs visibly threw up in his mouth, swallowed it, then made a farting sound with his slips and said, "Uhh.... I guess so."  He took the dish back to the kitchen, almost certainly spat on it, and wrapped the hunk of pork in tin foil and deposited it back on our table.  No bag, no container, just a tinfoil-wrapped slab of pork for my wife to carry around in her purse.  I guess.Yes, I know that taking leftovers to go is an American thing that isn't really done here.  But 1) I'm sure that we weren't the first Americans that Ludvigs ever waited on, and 2) You should never really throw up in your mouth in front of a customer.  Or at least try to be subtle about it.

9xr8IkBW0W-_zx9F1r0WTg.text: If you are planning on an allnighter with your friends then this is the place to come for breakfast around 4-5am.You have to pay an entrance fee of £2 but after a night of dancing and drinking you'd pay anything just to sit down and rest your sore feet.The breakfasts are great from pancakes and maple syrup to eggs bendict.The only downer for me is the music they play - its quite simply rubbish.The waiters are friendly and fun considering the time of morning.The perfect place to finish your evening.

HCXSIz3Arg48S-QnRZczfw.text: I love this place! Was here numerous times while staying in Soho on vacay.  Wonderful for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Everything delicious (crispy duck - Yum!)  Always open, courteous staff, great food.  Go here!

L1V3_mRXyiEP0vwqL9GHzQ.text: I used to love Balans, the waiters were nearly always smiling and friendly and the food great. Yesterday the guy serving us didn't smile once, I understand that it's a busy restaurant but they used to employ people who actually wanted to be there!I have a breakfast and you can't easily mess one if those up! It was just ok, sadly!

pB8wtQir1XUFnrj9rd8c1Q.text: Oh Balans, you saucy saucy soho staple...   Sigh. We can either blame my pristine sobriety on your star lossage, or (as I usually do,) we can blame the boogie. Three stars is certainly generous for my slow serviced and overly mayo'ed lunch experience. It's your call, really. Let's just consult Michael J for a final verdict: youtube.com/watch?v=vjW1…

bXuORNPx1Qn69dtrD-rqXw.text: Came here for brunch with some friends before they had to head back to good old San Diego. For a Sunday morning, the place wasn't too crowded. We got a good portion of food and good service. This is definitely not a destination stop, but will definitely serve a purpose and do a good enough job for what they do. There is another Balans just down the street. Not sure what the difference really is.

zXL8QO4jwY1QRcMSc33XJg.text: Woops reviewed the wrong Balans previously.Agreed that this Balans is definitely not Italian - perhaps Pan-Asian and eclectic is definitely a closer description.Sometimes real life is so ridiculous you have to laugh.For instance the service from our waiter was so awesomely bizarre, I obviously had to share.  Our waiter was cordial and attentive when he wasn't reading a newspaper. Seriously.Oh right, he forgot he wasn't at Starbuck's and actually working!  He was mostly fine though green and apathetic to our questions.  One friend asked the waiter if the sea bass or lamb shoulder is better.  Reply "One is lamb, is fish."  Only on more prompting, did he say the flavoring on lamb was tastier.  He uttered a similar response when I asked about the pork belly or the wild mushroom pasta.  "It's pasta."  The food itself was decent.  I had chicken liver salad with a poached egg (this was not really poached, more like almost hard-boiled) and it was standard.  My pork belly was seared so there was little fat left, but the meat still tender.  The sea bass was decent (not awesome).  The calamari was funny in there there were 4 pieces.  Yes, 4 for , £6.  While the dishes were mostly executed well, I thought the seasonings could have been more bold.  Prices were reasonable and dinner was about  £25/person with wine and shared starters.The funniest part to our fun waiter experience came at the end.  I hardly touched my pork belly (which was actually pretty sizeable) and asked to have it taken away.  The waiter looked like he was ready to heave and conceded,  but not happily.   I know wrapping leftovers is an American vestige, but you don't have to look like you're about to throw up in my food.Oh and the music is too loud, subpar trance music.  Mmm, goes so well with pork belly and conversation with friends.Ok food, but I'm sure there are better places in the area as well as places where the waiters aren't reading the newspaper.

-b7sOXQZc06tbPZaSTPskw.text: This was the worst burger I've had in years, could not finish it.  Explained to the waiter it was overcooked and nothing was done about it.  Service was mediocre to say the least.  Also, food took a long time to arrive. I guess every holiday has one bad meal, this was the one.  Overpriced and definitely not worth it.

O3-lrX6VUnnA2XYj-o6nmA.text: The ambience in Balans is fantastic.  It's definitely lively and even when you're massively hung over like I was on this vist, the mood just lifts you up and you can't help but order a cocktail or 3 with your dinner.Food-wise it's only okay.  On this occassion I had the crab linguine washed down with a mojito, caipirinha, and something slushy and strawberry which was deceptively strong despite it's cute appearance.  The linguine could definitely use a few more punches of flavours and the cocktail while good were not amazing.There are definitely better food and cocktails served elsewhere in London but I do return to Balans primarily because of the atmosphere, especially if I'm about to head out for the night, this place just puts me in the right mood for it.ps. They do a decent Sunday roast however for that calming comfort hug that you need after a big night out.

9Sa9O98B0bhxNCXhQQWlLg.text: i am in SOho for 10 days,  and London i think its my favor place on earth ,  for the past 4  years that i am  coming here,  i  end up  having my breakfast at Balans mostly ,  almost daily .   its one of my  favor place  ,  but also  coz its close to where i am  based . so  the food -  5 stars,   really  taste great  ,  very nice.the place  5  stars ,  looking great,  great  for  groups as well.  very  clean,  well done. my only things,  and  lol,  not coz i love food,   its,  some times, they  don't give you enough  food.  its kind of like,  getting out, and  still can  eat more.    maybe coz i am used to the US food,  and they always give you just enough   ,  or maybe  is just them.    overall  ,  great  place,   will be there this am as well  :)

jzYAn_1s3lHVBfuKjSURPw.text: We stumbled across this place quite by accident on our last day in London, and we could not have been more pleased! The service was top notch and the food was delicious (sea bass, pâté, scallops). Lots of energy and great people watching make this a place we'd come back to if we lived here.

Hfut584-3z0conXIY4gOiQ.text: Having been in London now for a few years, it took me a surprisingly long time to venture in and break my Balans virginity! I had always heard it "just wasn't great" or "the staff are rude", but I've been 4 times in the last 6 weeks and I think it's really nice!The staff have been delightfully friendly, cheeky and full of banter each time - which always scores highly with me. The menu is quite extensive, and certainly not overpriced - the 'afternoon after the night before' (as I like to call it) sunday roast with 2 drinks each came to £60 in total which I didn't think was too bad given the size of the portions, the double vodkas and the quality of the roast.Certainly great for a night before going on the sauce or recovering after one...

7kiUzPTtXzcTLhxogegUjQ.text: Cocktails! Cocktails! Cocktails! Balans is a great place to start a night out. The cocktails are delicious and nutritious (read: hella alcoholic). They do not sacrifice your alcohol content for taste so go nuts. That being said, I've been there on two occasions. Once, for drinks (insert giant thumbs up sign here) and once on a work function. The latter, sadly, did not involve alcohol so I was able to glean how good the food it.To start we had the calimari (decent), the duck spring rolls (avoid), chicken pot stickers (under-overwhelming), bread basket (best starter) and some olives (standard). Its nice that they have a variety. They are definitely sacrificing quality for diversity so be aware. If you are going to eat head straight for the mains.For my main meal, I ordered the prawn green curry with noodles. The prawns, like the noodles, were a little overcooked thus giving them a very rubbery texture. Yum (read: not)! Since, I wasn't impressed I was really holding out for dessert: Cheese Cake!Creamy. Cheesy. Delicious. Even though I ate enough for 3 people and a small child I still made room for dessert.

2mA3F7VDi7G8ZjrM40JkFA.text: If you're on track for a late one, it's definitely worth a visit to Balan's for breakfast at 5am. They have a large menu, the food is decent and the coffee is much-appreciated! The vegetarian breakfast burrito was delicious, and prices are not exorbitant (which they could be, given the late hour). I'm sure I'll be back here for another early breakfast soon!

QFnj14WcvhAW5nlsMX747w.text: Went here after a night of hanging with the bros in Soho. Ordered an app and a main, I will say the Gnocchi app was better than the main. Take heed, if you come from elsewhere besides the UK this Cobb Salad might not be what you've have tried in others. The dressing just wasn't a winner on any level. Thank god I my salad items came separated so I was able to salvage some sort of protein from my plate. The ambience was great, even the service was on point. The food was simply not good at all, my buddy mentioned the same thing about the burger her ordered and he's from the UK! This place should be used as a meeting place for apps and drinks. :/

YknWQai-lEWRMNMrmDphmA.text: Late night dinner, early morning breakfast - not sure how 3am meal after a night out qualifies, but Balans is really a place to be for it.I love the fact that staff is so nice to drunk people -I think they probably do realise that the drunkenness is what really earns them majority of the money - they are not going to throw you out if you appear tipsy at the door. It just means you're going to order a lot more you can eat :)The food itself could have been better - for example I did not like the seafood Jambalaya, though my friend swears by it. They do have nice calamari rings and scalops. And as far as I can recall on my post-birthday dinner/breakfast (at 3am!) I had a nice fish & chips.Do be aware that they stop serving alcohol at 3am...which is such a shame - majority of the clubs close at 3am and sometimes you just want to have that one drink - but it's not a reason not to give full 4 starts to the place.The place itself is clean in addition to all other its merits and as I said before - staff is nice and very patient.I love it - I love the atmosphere, kind of buzzy middle-of-the-night oasis of life - while soaked in alcohol Soho closes its eyes for the rest of the night.

2NVUBSis1GVVskvGTuawGw.text: If it's 2am and you're not in the mood for Chinatown delights or McDonalds, Balans is probably your best option in central London. It's on Old Compton Street in bustling Soho and often draws in the boisterous crowds after a late night pub and bar crawls. The food and cocktails are just average, not horrible by any means but just meh. Service is surprisingly friendly esp given how many drunks they must encounter. The place is clean and tries its best to look trendy, but at 2am you just want to fill your stomach before your journey home.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Chicken supreme
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Duck spring rolls

dKMvWDXF9_ZpzlutDac8fg.text: Great place for breakfast. Good staff and service and very decent food. Nice and buy atmosphere without being too noisy or overpowering.

C1GS-SEg38_6epYnfMipnw.text: Been many times and living in centre London Balans is one of my locals and funny enough we are regulars there. Slightly annoyed as have been informed today the table we're about to sit for our meal need to be vacated by 8.30. Now we have always been told Balans do NOT book tables so what is this about? Aparently regulares (which it looks like we are not even though we eat there once a week sometimes) can book tables! Feeling a bit insulted... I wonder if all the regulars are "Men"? Not good at all. Food still top quality, a bit loud at times but we enjoy the music and busy environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

CKoO0Gfj8EgMyNE5OudDaw.text: No Roast Beef left on a Sunday afternoon.Balans Chiswick & now Balans West Brompton have both closed.Long wait for expensive food in a deafening restaurant with small mean tables & high prices.Berry Smoothie had seperated or fermented.Disappointed my favourite restaurants are sliding down the quality scale.Staff are doing their best, but it's time to try other options....

X38vPGH5WKAXsParS3hm8w.text: The service is personal and quick. I loved the food. I had the full English. It was well cooked and well rounded. My husband had the cream cheese filled French toast and it was delicious as well since I stole a taste.

V8F4lmaEYEk8P8mKgAaZbw.text: COKE. DEN. I give this place five stars for the late night people-watching. I was fairly certain I had seen it all, until I walked into the bathroom and saw it filled to the brim with men and women doing coke off of the sinks. Amusing (yet slightly disturbing) people watching. OH, and the food is good too, albeit a bit overpriced.

wpjAUBaVKfT7XzarmtmNKA.text: Late night decent food spot best for after the club. We just needed some food (around 12 am) and our hotel concierge recommended this place since they were open late. Loud bumpin' vibe so the party doesn't have to stop. Feels like you're back in the club. Lots of people watching and ambiguously sexual patrons and waiters. Food is a solid 3. Drinks are a 2. Had to send back my all sugar and syrup martini. It was disgusting. Wine tasted like 2 buck chuck. All in all, they fed us when we needed to be fed. It's one of those last resort, but not the worst resort kind of spots.

Kyimth9uyi7Bxe4uVgjkWA.text: Great location. Needed food after getting pissed at Gordon's Wine Bar. After my meal, I found my second wind and subsequently closed Bar Soho and Club 49.Didn't really understand the need for a door man but whatever, the food did the trick and they had booze.If you find yourself here, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say you're having a cracker of a night.

6Oh1ESi8ej84BdbQjEuY3g.text: This place is a hot spot for those late night food cravings! They are open till 5am with alcoholic beverages available until 3am - only thing is, they ask for a £2.50 cover charge per person. Price per head is about £25 including a drink. The location is in the heart of Soho a little way down Old Compton Street. Vibrant atmosphere, good friendly service and British International food to die for! The decor is funky, modern and fresh. You almost feel like your in a trendy bar on the set of 'Sex and The City'. While you tuck into your tasty late night meal and get slozzled on Whisky sours, there is background music of old and new house, which is always appreciated. This is a great place to come before a night out or after! This is a popular branch but they also have others in Chiswick, Earls Court, Westfield and Kensington. I recommend the venison sausage and buttered garlic mash or the three egg omelette with spinach, salmon and sauteed potatoes! Nom nom!!! A great little gem in the buzzing area of Soho!

OsAB-5UDFzD86__t4MvxRA.text: Food is excellent the granola and yogurt with dried berries was just delicious. Loses a point for the just "meh" atmosphere. Otherwise, very much worth eating at (we did several times.)

k2UjOLJyumKIz-Mdhpgt_Q.text: On our last morning in London, my Wife's Aunt told us to check this place out because they had more of an American styled breakfast . We invited our good friend Chris R. to meet us. The service was pretty quick. I found it odd they put ice in my O.J. but I still enjoyed it. The espresso was damn good (they suck in the U.S.) I had ordered the big breakfast because I had a 14 hour flight ahead of me. It came with large pieces of bacon that was good (had to cut out a bunch of fat though). Sausage, toast, potatos,scrambled eggs, tomato, and mushrooms. Pretty good but nothing outstanding. A good place for a quick fill when on the go.

rXlq_PnqJP2rzDJ95PTAhQ.text: Food was fine, nothing special.Atmosphere was what you'd expect from a busy gay restaurant.Service... Bad.  Slow even by British standards. Aloof. The server forgot our drink order to begin with. He then got snotty because two of us ordered appetisers instead of entrees.. "this is dinner service.. You need to order dinner".Apparently he decided to make up the difference by adding drinks to our check that we never ordered or received.  Additionally, some of our drinks were a full £2 more than listed on the drink menu.We won't be going back here... If you risk it, make sure they don't pad your bill.

vqUQD07uxxGNKTilW3Kj3Q.text: The food isn't anything to write home about but it's decent. Came here for a bit of brunch so I ordered the eggs benedict with salmon (eggs royale) but the hollandaise sauce was quite bland and a bit too acidic. And it seemed quite hard to get service at times if you're inthe corner, it would always be the same guy running around trying to do everything. The table next to me just wanted drinks but they couldn't get anyone's attention until the last minute when they wanted to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict with Salmon - The eggs were cooked to perfection for me but the hollandaise sauce was too acidic and bland.

JEdrp_XE89m-q9ZsmyKk8g.text: I'm between and 3.5 and 4 star rating.Stopped in to Balans last night after being out drinking, and have to say it was a great decision. I had the traditional eggs benny with ham- it was definitely not the best eggs Benedict I've ever had, but it was good! The sauce, as others have commented, was a little acidic, but at 2 am who cares... It was a bit loud inside, but not nearly as loud as a club or bar would've been. Our waiter was super friendly, although it was hard to get his attention towards the end when we wanted to get and pay our bill.Overall, good experience. I'd go back.

c-l8s776Tx4B6nXbOWhJWA.text: Balans is nothing but consistent.   We have been coming for years and you always know that you will get great food in a friendly casual atmosphere. Great as a couple or as a group. If it's busy and you have to wait for a table it's no problem as you can grab a cocktail ( or two or three) at the bar.Always good value

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. A light snack
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

9xpzkyvOHz1pt5bqkRsqww.text: I go here for the Porn Star Martini's. They are the best and the staff is great. Dessert was awesome and huge and enough to feed 4 of us.

-YW42ATwSp096qT3w27z9Q.text: Love their Eggs Benedict staff is as friendly and efficient as the have been for the last 15?years I've been going here. Stop for lunch, dinner or late nite drop in with ur friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

NgWSE_kPjWc6NadML3Gh5A.text: I am pushing the boat out here and giving 4 stars instead of 3. It's surprisingly hard to find a nice place in seven dials for a bit to eat and this place is good with a. Aries menu.  Sure it is a bit more expensive than is completely reasonable,e - £6 for 2 eggs and some toast - but it's a nice place.  I had a wonderful kale and strawberry smoothie called the "elixir". I forgot to check the receipt to see how much it was - it was probably about a fiver. Oh well.

FrmaZvsrEXZ7ty0z7VQlkw.text: Summary: + A casual all-day restaurant + OK food and good location Overall: Balans is a casual all-day diner at the heart of Soho. It is stylish and casual. I tried mixed berry pancakes for a late breakfast on a weekday. Staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant was not very busy and the service was pretty quick. I went for mixed berry pancakes. The pancakes were good. They were fluffy like they should be. But they were a little too sweet as they were soaked with syrup. I much prefer to have syrup (and butter) separately so I can control how much stuff I add as I make my way through the stack of pancakes. I always enjoy eating the plain pancakes first before adding syrup. I have never been here in the evening but apparently they open till late.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Mixed berry pancakes (Balans)
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Balans

wIaz7UjYBFR1ybaPFyAuXg.text: Really enjoyed Balan's. Group of 5 girls. Food and service  were great. Open later. Most places close at 11pm. Highly recommend.

F4KS1hxCmKzJSiqjbBpNlg.text: Not divey, not too uptight. Just about good balance of party music, hipster crowd and drinks you can extend after midnight at Soho. Trust me you won't find better place than Balans after 1 am. Surprisingly they serve full breaky menu starting from midnight. Their poached eggs are legit. Don't forget to check out their velvet booths located at the back end of the place. Date worthy I must say.

zmgCfzvH7yn_1Hgh61NVBQ.text: The wife and I wanted some late night grub and found it here. Shared a burger, fish and chips and had a could martinis. Soho is always awesome and this made that much awesome-er...is that a word? Check it out and have fun!!!

jqkrb4mFkHRnslcZW7qnig.text: Honestly, the only reason I ate here was because I was a bit lost and had not had my breakfast, so I was a bit desperate. The servers were very nice but, to be honest, the food wasn't all that good. My omelette looked more like scrambled egg whites and the potatoes tasted like the frozen ones that you can buy at TESCO except these had obviously been fried in oil that had been used on something else as they tasted a bit odd. For such low quality food I would have expected to pay maybe £8 but nope, it was double that. Two stars for the server who appeared to be waiting all the tables on her own and was still very pleasant.

WfxJcWLSnjqP0iKfjd0gCw.text: So it's one am you want amazing drunk food and this place is open.  Gorgeous and does an amazing late night fish and chips.  And you don't have to eat it somewhere dodgy.  Lovely in all the right ways.

HRjaApVEoiKNQl-uduiLwA.text: I thought the food here was pretty good - I just had a couple of cocktails as well as a plate of Mediterranean appetizers.  Atmosphere is fun and lively and really helps with getting the evening started.

vF6r9TwZBnN11wOGLsRabg.text: We had an amazing mid-night snack here. Will definetely come back here again. I would recommend the fish and chips (you won't find better at this hour), the burger and the roasted chicken.

OWkXOwFhaqgALOIsDzLTXQ.text: Um. Let's start with the good:- kitchen opens late, serving courses until 3am- trendy modern ambiance- decent service- price is okay, around 7 for appetizers and 12-15 for mainsAnd then the not so good:- cocktail is way too sweet (pornstar for  9+GBP, felt like i was drinking passionfruit syrup)- food is just overly underwhelming. i tried: greek plate (pass), pot stickers (barely passes), pork belly (fail - worst dish possible), thai currie noodle (fail - really coagulated sesame/peanut paste), burger (fail - dry).  I would not eat here again.

ib-SM_daBYMt_3kkpu5dBA.text: Very contemporary hip space, with classic fare that hits the spot.  I had the fish and chips with mashed peas, generous portions, crispy and delicious!  We also tried the wild boar sausages and the sticky toffee pudding... Both top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Big portions, hip space

EBkIkV9gPbgObrwDPeXDEQ.text: Our meal was great. A very good surprice, not following the recommentation to others. Linguini with squit is highly recommended.

R8nwZtPEUVo_dUDzs9e4uw.text: Ok Balans, you've failed one too many times. I'll be back for lunch, snacks maybe, but your food is so poor these days I won't do dinner here again. What a shame, as your staff are great, location excellent, ambience wonderful, even the food presentation is good. Taste though tells a different tale, and its one of bought-in defrosted, sub-par food. Please fix your kitchen problems, because I really want to patronize your restaurant! He'll I'm in there 5 times a week sometimes!

Ld3VB3ADYvQUslkcfXHFSQ.text: Simply reviewing the breakfast here as it was recommend by a friend and local.  Balans has the perfect mix of English & American breakfast items to get your day started right, or to dry and soak up the beverages from the evening before (this is London afterall).   Traditional English breakfast was solid, but they also have crispy American bacon and dishes that feel just lie home

v1TW8hlVRGf_bNuD7ufBIA.text: What have they done to you, my Balans? You used to be the foxiest place on Ild Compton Street. Always welcoming with a cheeky cocktail, a seductive waiter and some (admittedly average) food in a great setting. And now the revamp. All that is left is the food, and that isn't better. The new interiors are awful. May be they attract suburban yummy mummies but they are not the sexy gay environment they used to be.

s2UixzdWgvoM0J-rMnQTwQ.text: We were on day four in London and were searching for an excellent breakfast.  It seems most places in London tend to overlook eggs and we wanted to find a location that did not do that and offered Gluten Free Bread.  This restaurant was recommended to us by our Concierge.  What a great place.  The service was very nice and the food was outstanding.  The eggs were cooked perfect and the bacon was fantastic.  The location was just perfect as we wanted to travel on the Covenant Square after.  For sure this was our best breakfast out in our UK travels.  I highly recommend it.

uNZPIlyqDmieejJYHE6MKQ.text: Great place for late night eats. We just stopped in on a Thursday night and it was a great find. The food is great and good portions. Nice options. We had the fish and chips, pork taco starters, and the crab linguine. All were good and we cleaned our plates. Pricing is moderate and in the heart of the gay bar area. So if your partying till 2 am like us and need food, come here

nQrz1BRqnqcbAZKlEGZ_yw.text: Arrived at London super hungry after a long flight, so my friend and I decided to grab a bite at Balans since it was two doors away from our flat.Used to New York "bar food" we were not expecting anything extraordinary but I must admit we were wrong!Their fish tacos are amazing(please make sure to order them) and also their scallops (not chewy at all)Overall a pleasant experience including both of our waiters whore were super nice, professional and helpful!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

P3274tOgL-ahP4-FjeR0kw.text: I got the red-curry chicken dish and it was delicious 8/10. The dish wasn't too spicy, and came with a side of white rice. The service was great and we enjoyed sitting at the window-bar area to people watch.

bW9256mrGQUZOZcmHkS3MA.text: These guys do it right.  The service was incredible and the food was amazing. We ordered the burger and the club sandwich (highly recommend). We will be back.

QXw1McBIZZOJnCYIcUd5sA.text: I'm basing this review on a single £13.85 visit. One order.  Breakfast.  It's a great location for people watching. A table in the sun on the street watching the colorful soho crowd, excellent. 5 stars. The prices are on the high side ie £9 for two poached eggs on a "muffin" with a slice of salmon.  Which gets me to my order. The Eggs Benedict.  Poached eggs on salmon and a toasted muffin with hollandaise sauce.  The basic dish.  So it arrives. No dressings or frills or sides just the two dressed eggs.  The muffin is not a muffin but more like a white roll. So the outside of it is lightly toasted but what ends up being the meal is, you're eating your eggs on white untoasted bread. Not good. Then the hollandaise sauce on top of the eggs is cold. So your whole meal is now on the cold side.  It must be said that the poached eggs are made to perfection but with cold sauce on the top and a fluffy bread base, it's ruined.  The salmon is very salty. And the Americano coffee is too strong.  So I guess, go there for the location, just be careful and specific when you order.

5Nwyeb75wXJNI1r-SbVx_A.text: Okay so my friends lied to me and said all food in London was terrible and be prepared !!! This place was great! The flavor and taste of my breakfast burrito was so good. It rivals the states!  Granted this was a back up from the restaurant we wanted to go to called The Breakfast Club it was a great choice. The atmosphere is cool too! Service was good but a little bit on the slower chill side.I would come back if I am ever in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

71XalqWuSXVqA8We99HH_Q.text: So my other 4 friends and I booked a table to have a relaxed meal, what we booked was what we got, I had three cocktail, and a starter we all had the burger from a menu that was not too complex. The staff was attentive, friendly and was relaxed in their style and attitude towards serving us. So knowingly that we were in the heart of the gay 'village' and we were all gay diners the staff was not overly pushing their flamboyance on us but we made sure that we did. The decor of the place was nicely done with a modern look. Food pricing was a moderate

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

gjEL6_9hFHm845DpofzoBg.text: Racially Profiled My First Night in London, how exciting! Goes without saying I was excited for my first evening in London when we found this bar/restaurant. The place was full for the most part, with a few unbussed tables in front and some empty tables I could see in the back. There was however no hostess to indicate if it was seat yourself service or wait to be seated. After a awkwardly waiting by the entrance with no sign of an employee working the door, I decided to walk over to a server terminal where I saw someone putting in an order, to request a table. I asked if we could be seated, and the man (later told me his name was Victor) asked how many. I told him 2 and gestured towards my sister still standing by the door. He looked over, then replied there would be about a 30 minute wait, to which I said OK that's fine, could you add us to the list please. He said well, we stop serving alcohol at quarter past 12, so you wouldn't be able to get anything to drink after then. I was surprised by how early bars closed here, and asked if he had the current time, to see if we would still be able to have at least 1 cocktail after the wait. He said it was 11:45, meaning we would be seated after drink service. Convenient. I pointed out that there were a few empty tables, and would it be possible to just sit for a drink before last call to which he again insisted there was a wait list and suggested we leave and try somewhere else.I looked around and realized there was no one else standing or waiting around the door or restaurant waiting for a seat. So I asked him, where are the other patrons on your wait list, certainly you could start seating some now. He said they were no longer at the restaurant but he was sticking to the wait list and wouldn't be able to seat us. At this point, I started realizing what was going on. And started asking if he had a contact number for his phantom wait list party, were they aware tables were open, was it possible they may have gone somewhere else, was he truly going to deny service to us to which he replied"I am". Besides the fact that we were denied seating in a bar with several open seats, the nonchalant manner with which I was dismissed (responding to my questions in brief, curt phrases, not even looking at me when we spoke), it was so rude. I asked if there was a manager, which he said he was. 2 black females walk into a bar. The End. Because racism. Disgusting!

KwPkufmfYj51SIpS8zAhiA.text: Degge du musst es akzeptieren.There actually not a single thing i could criticize about the Balans. The interior is very comfortable and charming, the staff is friendly and attentively.The food is excellent. The High society eggs is very recommendable and have a lovely taste. We've had breakfast in here twice and both times we were fully satisfied!Definitely going to come back the next time were in London!

woytMl4QNjd2VkDV8eNV4A.text: Walking the streets of London and found this gem Very cool English Breakfast met expectations ! Covent Gardens

HF-Gy9bcpUHciOXX6Yz2cQ.text: To be honest, I think Balan's deserves 3.5 stars rather than 3.  Balan's has standard brunch fare (3 stars) with trendy ambiance (+0.5). I ordered the lobster eggs benedict, which was pretty tasty to be honest.  The lobster was sweet and tender, the egg poached to perfection.  My only complaint was that the hollandaise was slightly too acidic.  In my opinion, if the hollandaise isn't perfect then it throws the entire dish off.  My friend had the steak and eggs, which were reportedly 'OK.'The servers were attentive and we weren't rushed out of the restaurant even though a queue was forming at the door.  We booked our table, although it seemed like quite a few people were coming in without reservations.  I would personally suggest taking advantaging of a restaurant with reservations in Soho, they're not easy to come by! Overall, brunch at Balan's was good but not great.  I'll probably return at some point!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict with lobster and bacon!

xXbnHUVeybdnpCvSpGZbZw.text: Very relaxing atmosphere. Nice staff. Good food. Located at Old Compton Road in Soho. Try the High Society Eggs Benedict. They bring a selection of olives and artisan bread, a very nice touch. Priced reasonable. Gratitude incl.

LvbK2vCsNYtphBYSGWhv0Q.text: I was so hungry when I got to this place. I ordered the chicken sandwich with no lettuce or tomato and fries. It came out on time as ordered. I even got a delightfully miniaturuzed mayonnaise and ketchup container for my fries. Great sandwich. Also a good spot to people watch. It was exactly what I was looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Chicken sandwich with fries

J51515iGVVvTEli6fdqEFg.text: This is our first time in London. After going to sleep at 6pm local time from exhaustion, we woke up at 1am starving. Googled and Yelped and found this place. Best decision ever! The atmosphere is amazing and the food is out of this world!!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

6sKh94U87yv99jBtpIVtpQ.text: Nice place to grab a bit and drinks, although does get a bit rowdy during the weekend which is expected. I got their tuna salad which was good but could use more of their dressing/sauce.

ak9PIDgSX_i5NPrxBM5MRA.text: Had a light breakfast (eggs diablo?).  Eggs cooked in a tomato salsa, a few potatoes, very spicy, but good.  Very similar to "huevos rancheros" if you are from the US.  Just missing the corn tortillas!  Which it needed. I'm not a fan of coffee, but I did taste my daughter's and it was very good.  Service was excellent! Although they do try to 'up charge' every order by asking if you would like to add a side of bacon, or sausage etc.  We just stuck to what was offered on the menu item itself.

PvuBr4kLMJfSpVBYjwGNGg.text: Went for brunch yesterday and had a great experience at Balans Soho Society. The food was delicious. I had the Eggs Benedict with ham and wasn't disappointed. It had a squeeze of lemon on the muffin, so be aware if you're not a fan of citrus. The atmosphere was lovely and we were able to sit there for about 2 and a half hours without any problems. The service was very attentive, possibly even too attentive! Definitely an element of up-selling but it was very reasonably priced for a restaurant in Soho. Overall it was a wonderful Sunday experience and I would definitely go again, and recommend to others!

Vq_K7OKxo2NBywI88sbrkw.text: Arrived from The US, and wanted a traditional Full English breakfast. I asked the girl at The W where she would go. She suggested Balans. I have a marvelous breakfast, and terrific waitress. Enjoyed Myself so much, I returned that Sunday morning, after Mass. had another terrific breakfast, a Benedict, this time. And had a gray conversation with a patron, at the table next to mine(too bad I did not meet him when I first arrived in London). People and staff, first rate.

cCkTWwrHwbJdHBVK72aPbQ.text: I've come to Balans on several occasions and it does what it does well and 24hours a day! I wouldn't say the food is outstanding - but it's pretty decent and I seem to find myself coming back time and time again (especially after those nights out and everything other than McDonalds is closed)I came here for brunch this morning and whilst service was pretty quick and the food was tasty as always, there was a lot of things wrong with our order due to miscommunication. Nothing drastic to worry about though, it was all sorted out pretty quickly & we enjoyed yet another meal at Balans. It's just one of those easy to go to casual places to come to in soho.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Pancake!

4oCDtCTVLjCyLOYI6_SBag.text: Very busy place, high turnover. Got recommended the Lamb steak which was nice, beans suffered from sitting under the heat lamp too long, but presentation overall was good. Wine selection is limited but of good quality.

DYBbVZVVnTBBx3Jhjgjk1w.text: Balans is the liveliest restaurant in Central London with the friendliest staff and best cocktails! And if you're looking for an amazing burger, look no further. Also very reasonably priced for location and quality of food.

-tx_Kirun0rcdGrm8IcINw.text: I'm surprised to read some of the reviews on Balans. We came here for my birthday meal with a large group of friends and had a fantastic time! From the second I walked in the door our waiter made a complete fuss over me and had such good rapport with our table he practically ate with us! We were seated in one of the large circular booths at the back of the restaurant which was spacious and quite private. The menu is nice and reasonably priced for Central London. I wasn't keen on my scallop starter - they were almost under-cooked and a little watery but it didn't matter to me as I was having a rare old time knocking back the Prosseco and a very well made mojito! The main course was delicious I have to say, I had the bavette and it was really very good! Everyone at our table enjoyed their main meals - the desserts were fantastic also! I love the coolness, the campness and the sexy vibe of this restaurant. Someone else said Balans was pretentiousyes, and...It is, but it's what makes it.

T-9oJDvro6e8UYlQnniiDA.text: I love Balans! It is a good reliable staplein Soho. The food is always good, not always great but always good. The service is super and the staff really look after you. I have been eating their thia chicken noodles for more years than I care to remember!

png0LE4uN5cQTIvdFUshhQ.text: I just read through some of the last reviews and I think summed up it just confirms what my problem with Balans is...in that I don't know what my problem is...I just know that I have one. I was thinking it was the menu - it's such a hotch potch of dishes and cuisines you can't really see a theme, but then that's not a big problem is it? So,maybe it was the food itself...my starter of scallops with a caulliflower puree was really nice but then our calamari seemed like that frozen stuff. Or mains were a bit more of a miss. Seafood jambalaya needed a bit more flavour. My swordfish was ok, but again I think a frozen steak and the blackbean rice wasn't seasoned or cooked long enough. BUT, again, if you look at the prices, what were we really expecting? Ok, maybe the service? No, our waiter was really friendly and smiley and even knew that my friend always had extra toast when she goes in! Decor? hmm..more shadow lounge than restaurant but so what. In conclusion...if you want somewhere cheap and very cheerful right in the heart of Soho that's open until sunrise'o'clock than this is the place....but keep your expectations at the door!
